New Records: Kieffer Moore’s opener was timed at 37 seconds – Wales’ fastest goal since 2003 – and ended their longest scoreless streak of four games since September 2012.
Key Match Events: Kieffer Moore pounced on the ball in the box and lashed home off the post with only 38 seconds on the clock.
Harry Wilson thumped a long-range strike into the net to give Wales a two-goal lead.
Stefan Jovetic hit the bar from the halfway line and missed a sitter which was well saved by Welsh keeper Karl Darlow.
Driton Camaj eventually pulled one back in the second half.
Goalkeeper Mijatovic was sent up for the final corner of the game but couldn’t get hold of the ball and the final whistle blew as Wales cleared.
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy’s side secured an opening draw with Turkey as Montenegro lost 2-0 to Iceland.
Wales made five changes as teenager Lewis Koumas started in attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy watched his new-look side continue their more aggressive, front-foot approach.
Wales claimed their first win under Craig Bellamy with a 2-1 Nations League success over Montenegro on a rain-lashed night in Niksic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game played out in driving rain.
